comment: She was a great teacher! I took her online math class, and she gave lots of partial credit on tests. There is a good amount of homework, but that is expected for a math class. The reviews she gives for the tests are basically the test! She responds to emails quickly, and she is very caring!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took her course online and ended up withdrawing. She requires a lot of work. She makes you turn in a lot in just the first two weeks of the semester. The exams are lockdown browser with camera. Be prepared for a lot of homework and doing work everyday for hours, especially if you're not great at math. Wouldn't recommend taking her online at least

97 in the class. She is extremely nice and VERY THOROUGH. Do NOT take if you're not ready to put in the work. Weekly homework assignments, no quizzes, 4 tests (lockdown), and a final (lockdown). Only thing that annoyed me were the steps I had to take for the tests and submitting the work. ALWAYS open to emails, provides lots of resources too.

She was so sweet; sometimes, she made her own mistakes but fixed them and explained why. Gave out hand-outs to go with every lecture. Attendance was mandatory, but if you missed a couple of classes, it wouldn't kill your grade. Very ALEKS heavy, but if you did them every week, your grade stays high. Very helpful if you have a question or need help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: It goes without saying for every math class you will have a lot of homework, but the homework was self-guided and she gave ample time for it to be completed. She's very easy to ask questions if you're struggling and will try to help you at any moment. Attendance is mandatory (points will be taken off)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Very good at showing examples and explaining why something is done this way. She is a very nice and sweet teacher. Very ALEKS heavy but, it is needed as long as you do the homework and study guides it is an easy A.

Such a sweet teacher! She wants you to actually learn. Very Alks heavy but it helps you learn. Attendence is mandatory if you miss one day youll be lost. Does go at a fast pace but its not her fault shes a good teacher you just have to do your work, come to class, and use alks and you will pass.

She's nice and fairly easy. She does go pretty fast in the classes, but if you have questions she will stop and answer them for you. She responds to emails quickly and isn't super tough on grading. There's a lot of homework in Aleks, which is where a lot of your grade comes from. Do that and you'll be fine. Quizzes and tests are on paper.

Teacher is an absolute sweetheart and helps you if you need help. However there is a LOT of homework for this class and all she uses in ALEKS which is kind of annoying. Attendance is mandatory and taken for a grade. You don't want to miss a class tho because you will get behind.

super super nice professor. there are ten quizzes but she drops the lowest 7 which is saving my grade rn tbh. 3 tests as well which are EXACTLY like the aleks homework and study guides. i hate math with a passion but she makes it somewhat bearable

One of the best professors I've had at KSU. She has hundreds of students but remembers everyone's name and takes time to get to know everyone. ALEKS homework can be time-consuming, but it's very easy if you do it consistently and take practice tests that are exactly like the tests.

I'm not sure what these people are talking about but this class was insanely hard. She gives a lot of ALEKS which sucks. if you miss just one of them ur so screwed. Now the teacher her self is a sweetheart.she doesn't really explain the problems. she doesn't go step by step but just skips steps so if you need that this is not the class for you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Generally an easy teacher, if you have to take math 1111 or just need to take an algebra 2 class for the SAT or ACT then this is the teacher.

Mrs. Teresa was outstanding. The grading criteria for the class was extremely clear and the tests were easy. She gave extra credit  for test preps, and would drop the lowest few homework and quiz grades. You have to try hard to fail her class. she loves all her students and will do anything for them!

Overall great professor that cares about her students. Attendance and class participation ends up being extra credit. Always was timely and helpful when emailed; she is always prepared and early for class. Genuinely cares about students wellbeing and wants them to succeed in this class.

So I took Teresa Fuston in the fall of 2021 but I would say she is a good teacher. She does take attendance everyday and The class is very ALEKS HEAVY which she gives you a week to do and you have more then 3 tests the semester but on the bright side she does give you half points on tests if you get the question-semi right She is very sweet though

Mrs Fuston is an incredible teacher. I was expecting a tough math class with a mean run-of-the-mill math professor, but she reminded me of a high school teacher (which she recently retired from being one I believe). It was really refreshing, as she was able to answer any questions I had. She is so caring. A lot of ALEKS homework, but not too bad.
